physical_examinations.vital_signs: Cortisol undetectable on several occasions; ACTH undetectable; hypoglycemia noted.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete isolated corticotrope deficiency with undetectable ACTH and low dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate. Pituitary MRI was unremarkable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 19, admitted for septic shock due to a pulmonary infection. Complete cortisol and ACTH deficiency was confirmed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrent infections, bronchial infections, pneumococcal bacteremia, and episodic severe infections. Pituitary MRI revealed a hypoplastic gland and thin stalk.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Severe infections and absence seizures ceased completely under hydrocortisone replacement therapy.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Cortisol and ACTH were found undetectable even after CRH test.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pituitary MRI showed a hypoplastic gland. Subnormal GH response to stimulation noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After hydrocortisone and GH replacement therapies, patient grew normally and severe infections stopped.
